definition:
The [*aspect ratio*]{} of a rectangular image display area is the ratio
of the width of the rectangle to its height, expressed either as a ratio
of coprime integers or a real number to 1. The two most commonly used
aspect ratios are “fullscreen” (4:3 or 1.66:1) and “widescreen” (16:9 OR
2.35:1).

For example, a detail from Leonardo da Vinci’s [*Mona Lisa*]{} in a
fullscreen aspect ration:

![image](MonaLisa_FullScreen)

And in a widescreen aspect ratio:

![image](MonaLisa_WideScreen)
